(5/1/20) Third resident dies, was incarcerated on death row in Florence facility (https://kvoa.com/coronavirus-coverage/2020/05/01/attorney-arizona-death-row-inmate-dies-from-covid-19/)  (4/28/20) second resident death, at Florence ( https://www.fox10phoenix.com/news/details-released-on-first-deaths-from-coronavirus-in-arizona-prisons ) ----- (4/27/20) AZ is not releasing official officer infection information (https://www.abc15.com/news/local-news/investigations/experts-arizona-officials-unlawfully-holding-covid-19-information)  (4/27/20) article reports first resident fatality, from the state prison in Tucson, which it reports as happening "two weeks ago" (https://kvoa.com/coronavirus-coverage/2020/04/27/details-released-about-arizona-prisons-first-covid-19-death/)  (4/22/20) article reports at least 30 officers infected across seven prison complexes (https://www.abc15.com/news/local-news/investigations/lack-of-covid-19-testing-information-raises-questions-in-arizona-prisons)  (4/16/20) ADOC is refusing to release officer positive numbers (https://www.abc15.com/news/local-news/investigations/arizona-department-of-corrections-not-releasing-number-of-positive-tests-of-officers) (4/15/20) 20 staff are positive across Arizona CPOA ( https://www.abc15.com/news/local-news/investigations/adoc-officer-speaks-out-after-testing-positive-for-coronavirus ) ----- (4/10/20) third inmate tests positive (https://www.azcentral.com/story/news/local/arizona-breaking/2020/04/09/3rd-arizona-inmate-tests-positive-coronavirus-florence-prison/5128381002/) ----- (4/8/20) two inmates tested positive ( https://corrections.az.gov/sites/default/files/notifications/adcrr-covid-19-update-4-7-20.pdf ) ----- (4/1/20) management strategy update: "Of the more than 42,000 inmates currently housed in ADCRR custody and care,
there are no known cases of the COVID-19. Of those inmates evaluated for flu-like symptoms,
34 inmates have been tested for COVID-19, 29 are negative, and 5 test results are currently
pending. " ( https://corrections.az.gov/sites/default/files/notifications/adcrr-covid-19-update4-1-20.pdf )
Three staff infected: https://www.abc15.com/news/local-news/investigations/documents-show-only-30-of-symptomatic-inmates-in-az-have-been-tested-for-coronavirus

(4/26/20) 229 residents currently positive, 232 no longer positive, so 461 total; 158 corrections officers and 35 other staff currently infected (reported this plus 170 recovered as total staff infection number) (4/21/20) reported Cook County as displayed - 235 positive residents, 180 positive staff, with recovered in separate columns  (4/15/20) CC dashboard says 181 residents positive, 156 recovered, 3 died (340 total), and 203 officers plus 20 recoverd, 223  (4/13/20) CC Dashboard says 323 positive (including 144 who have recovered) and 3 dead. 196 staff positive + 18 recovered = 214 total ----- (4/13/20) Cook County dashboard indicates 1 resident who tested positive for COVID and died may have died of cardiac arrest  (4/12/20) article says 3 resident deaths, 306 resident positives, and "over" 180 staff infections at Cook now ( https://abc7chicago.com/3rd-cook-county-jail-detainee-with-covid-19-dies/6098349/ ) ----- (4/9/20) article says resident positive count now up to 251 ( https://chicago.cbslocal.com/2020/04/09/family-of-cook-county-jail-inmate-who-died-of-covid-19-files-lawsuit-takes-issue-with-practice-of-shackling-inmates-to-hospital-beds/ ) ----- (4/8/20) NYTimes has same numbers as day before with 238 residents and 115 staff positive. 1 resident dead from day before ( https://www.nytimes.com/2020/04/08/us/coronavirus-live-updates.html?action=click&module=Spotlight&pgtype=Homepage#link-7634e187 ) ----- (4/7/20) (https://abc7chicago.com/coronavirus-chicago-death-cook-county-jail/6082546/)

(4/28/20) article reports two positive resident tests, one at Jackie Brannon and one who tested positive after release - these are presumably counted as hte cumulative 2 on OK's tracker, but are not currently attributed to a facility  (4/27/20) article I found online linked to this page ( http://doc.publishpath.com/websites/doc/images/covid-19/covid-19%20stats%20report.pdf ) which is a tracker of some sort. Not sure if it gets overwritten an updated or not. Worth checking every day I think ----- (4/24/20) article says 8 staff and 2 residents positive, so added 1 resident positive to state-wide count since it didn't specify where ( https://statescoop.com/oklahoma-prisons-among-first-track-covid-19-cases-software/ ) ----- (4/16/20) article says 8 staff across system are now positive. Left the 1 count at Joseph Harp since we know that one for sure (could be an undercount there now though). ( https://www.kosu.org/post/oklahoma-inmates-tense-prisons-become-covid-19-hotbeds ) ----- (4/13/20) article repeats 5 staff members and 1 resident from previous week (https://www.publicradiotulsa.org/post/covid-19-risk-grows-prisons-oklahoma-pardon-and-parole-board-may-streamline-commutations)  (4/8/20) article says 5 staff and 1 resident sick. Gives breakdown of location for two of them. Rest coded as state-wide. ( https://www.publicradiotulsa.org/post/oklahoma-doc-reports-5-staff-members-1-inmate-positive-covid-19 ) ----- (4/3/20) article says

(5/7/20) due to difficulty tracking facilities at which resident fatalities occur, all resident fatalities are now reported state-wide; the fatalities represents the "Covid-19 Presumed Death" count reported by TDCJ  (5/5/20) article reports 5 staff fatalities (https://www.kwtx.com/content/news/Texas-prison-COVID-19-death-toll-rises-570190701.html)  (5/3/20) Main covid-19 update page reports 96 staff recoveries  (4/30/20) Total offender positive is 1118, employee total 394,  16 resident fatalities, assigned 4 fatalities to facilities as indicated on main Covid-19 update page  (4/28/20) total offender positive is 950, resident deaths at 12 - not all attributable to facility, spillover in statewide  (4/26/20) Total offender positive is 806, "positive tests" total is 740, staff "positive tests" is 294, recovered numbers are on main COVID page  (4/23/20) staff recovery number listed on main covid page (https://www.tdcj.texas.gov/covid-19/index.html)  (4/23/20) tracker reports 7 resident deaths, but facility unclear for one, so counted it in the state-wide column; tracker also reports 693 "positive tests," and 594 "total offender positive," neither of which matches the total of the positive tests column  (4/23/20)  article reports locations of two additional resident deaths, staff death (https://www.kwtx.com/content/news/Texas-prison-correctional-officer-with-COVID-19-dies-569859801.html)  (4/22/20) 1 staff died at Clements, 2 residents died at Wynne and Telford ( https://www.kbtx.com/content/news/Second-Texas-prison-correctional-officer-with-COVID-19-dies-569860551.html ) ----- (4/17/20) article reports second resident fatality at Telford (https://www.easttexasmatters.com/news/second-east-texas-inmate-dies-from-coronavirus-13-more-employees-test-positive/)
